channel.title: Chrome not working at all
channel.description:
Okay, so my chrome stopped working. Out of the blue, just while browsing these forums. I can't even load a single page (using firefox right now) without chrome telling me that it has frozen. For example, I open chrome, and wait for the homepage to load. I stare at a blank screen for a moment or two, then I get this:
[img]https://img180.imageshack.us/img180/3398/chromeshit.png[/img]
I click "Kill pages", but that doesn't do a thing, as the page still tries to load.
And you know that speed-dial screen (or whatever the hell it's called) that shows up when you open a new tab? Well that doesn't work. It just shows a blank screen.
I've also tried Iron, but that doesn't work either, which I think means that it's a problem with the whole Chromium software thing.
So, yeah, if you have any suggestions, or this happened to you before, post it here please.

item.title: Chrome not working at all
item.dc:creator: horizonbreakk
item.description:
un install it.
Run ccleaner. clean regs.
then fresh install.

Read full topic

item.title: Chrome not working at all
item.dc:creator: Mr.F
item.description:
Diabeetus:

This happened to me, I fixed it by opening task manager and quitting chrome under the processes tab. Hope it helps.

Well yeah, it shuts down chrome, but it still isn’t working when I open it again.
And yes, I did try rebooting my computer.

Read full topic
